name: Congressman Jared Golden
tweet_text:
#LeadFreeFuture ensures that when federal dollars are used to finance housing through agencies like the VA, those homes are lead-free. 

We shouldn’t spend money to put Americans in houses that will poison them. 5/

name: Congressman Jared Golden
tweet_text:
#LeadFreeFuture requires participating states to lower their standard for blood lead levels to the CDC level. 

That’s critical for identifying more poisoned kids, catching poisoning earlier, and identifying more sources of hazards. 4/

name: Congressman Jared Golden
tweet_text:
#LeadFreeFuture invests almost $2.5 billion/year for 5 years in lead abatement. 

That investment will remove lead from about 220,000 homes/year. 

It’s estimated that every dollar spent on lead abatement returns at least $17 to communities. 3/

name: Congressman Jared Golden
tweet_text:

name: Congressman Jared Golden
tweet_text: Management of ME fisheries should be based on the best available data & science, but that clearly hasn't happened here. On behalf of Maine's lobstermen, I urge NOAA Fisheries to postpone its rulemaking and engage with stakeholders to develop an accurate risk assessment tool. 6/

name: Congressman Jared Golden
tweet_text: And the underlying data used in the risk assessment tool might not tell us the whole picture. Stakeholders tell us there’s a good chance the model generated by the tool won’t account for the present-day distributional shift of the right whales. 5/

name: Congressman Jared Golden
tweet_text: NOAA’s risk assessment tool is a scientific model with implications for thousands of Mainers and an entire species of whale, but it hasn’t been peer-reviewed. The tool wasn’t even made public until a few days ago. 4/

name: Congressman Jared Golden
tweet_text: In the last 2 yrs, 12 of the 20 stranded right whales found were discovered in Canadian waters, where Canadian fishermen aren’t subject to the same whale protection measures. But the risk assessment tool fails to incorporate the impact of Canadian fisheries on whale deaths. 3/

name: Congressman Jared Golden
tweet_text:
NOAA Fisheries' new restrictions are supposed to protect the right whale. But the method NOAA uses to justify these rules – called the ‘risk assessment tool’– uses data & assumptions that may be unreliable.

More info here: https://t.co/cWFUN8AdkW
#mepolitics 2/ https://t.co/2CbTHwSeyn

name: Congressman Jared Golden
tweet_text: NOAA Fisheries is meeting this week to discuss new restrictions that could put many Maine lobstermen out of business. Thanks to @RepCasten, @RepSlotkin, @RepGilCisneros, @RepMaxRose, and @chelliepingree for joining me to introduce the FLAT Prices Act in the House.

name: Congressman Jared Golden
tweet_text:
We need common-sense solutions to lower healthcare costs. Addressing the rising cost of Rx drugs is a step we can take right now. 

Today, I introduced the FLAT Prices Act to help prevent abusive drug companies from jacking up drug prices on the American people. #mepolitics https://t.co/krxR9U23pc

name: Congressman Jared Golden
tweet_text:
How do corporations get away with this? 

When they develop a new drug, the gov’t gives Rx companies a years-long monopoly. They can skyrocket prices with no competition. It’s a system intended to promote R&D, but many pharma companies abuse it on the backs of Maine people.

name: Congressman Jared Golden
tweet_text: Rx drug prices have been out of control for years, but in 2016 we saw just how abusive drug companies had become. In the space of 9 years, amid record profits, Mylan shot its prices for the life-saving allergy drug Epipen up by 400% https://t.co/lJAJ9deuc8

name: Congressman Jared Golden
tweet_text:
Higher Rx drug prices are one of the biggest drivers of rising healthcare costs. Maine people spend at least twice as much on prescription drugs as we did thirty years ago. 

Democrats, Republicans, and everyone in between agrees: this is a problem & we need to fix it. https://t.co/RrQ0Xc1IK7

name: Congressman Jared Golden
tweet_text:
I met with the Maine Medical Association to discuss how we can make healthcare more affordable for Maine people. 

One thing I brought up: the cost of prescription drugs. Year after year, Mainers get soaked by high drug prices. It's past time our country addressed this issue. https://t.co/DbZecil8Oe

#MEpolitics

name: Congressman Jared Golden
tweet_text: We’re hearing the president will call for both parties to put aside their differences & come together. I welcome that message, but he has to back it up with leadership. We need to see concrete proposals from @POTUS and willingness to work with both parties to get this done 11/

name: Congressman Jared Golden
tweet_text: That’s why Maine needs strong federal funding to build infrastructure that grows our economy, creates good jobs, & connects our businesses and homes. I’ll be listening for @POTUS to seize the moment, work across the aisle, and outline a real infrastructure plan. #mepolitics 10/

name: Congressman Jared Golden
tweet_text: Here’s the thing: Maine isn’t NY or CA and we’re more than 90% small biz. An infrastructure plan that requires private investment and lots of state and local gov’t $$$ won’t work here. #mepolitics 9/

name: Congressman Jared Golden
tweet_text: Investing in infrastructure is huge for #ME02. We’re 1 of the most rural districts in the US, & we’re the biggest east of the Mississippi. Bad roads, bridges, rail, & poor broadband internet access quite literally hold our families, workers, & businesses back. #mepolitics 8/

name: Congressman Jared Golden
tweet_text: Here’s another area where I want to work with the president: INFRASTRUCTURE. There’s a real opportunity here for both parties to work together with @POTUS and get something done for Mainers. Few states would benefit more from better roads, bridges, etc than Maine. #mepolitics 7/

name: Congressman Jared Golden
tweet_text: I’ll work with @POTUS when his policies help Mainers, but I’ll fight back when his policies hurt our state. I’ll work with the president to overhaul NAFTA if he's serious about protecting Maine jobs, but this deal comes up short. 6/ #mepolitics #replaceNAFTA https://t.co/41aiZiIWpA

name: Congressman Jared Golden
tweet_text: .@POTUS' NAFTA 2.0 must be changed to do more to keep good jobs in Maine and increase wages. And trade deals aren’t worth the paper they’re written on if other countries don’t play by the rules, so we need stronger enforcement provisions. #mepolitics 5/

name: Congressman Jared Golden
tweet_text: The president’s NAFTA 2.0 proposal appears to be more of the same. It looks like a new paint job on the old NAFTA, not the meaningful change we need. Too many Maine communities know where this path leads: closed mills, outsourcing, and low wage jobs. #mepolitics 4/
